message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product for sale. I think you'll love it, and I'm confident you'll find it valuable. I'm willing to let it go for $15000. What do you think?
I'm really interested in the product, but $15000 is a bit out of my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $10000. Can you meet me in the middle at $12500?

I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. I can see you're willing to make a serious offer, but I'm not quite ready to meet you at $12500. I can do $13500, which is a bit closer to my original price. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $13500 is still a bit steep for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $12000 and $13500, so I'll offer $12750. Can you consider that?
I appreciate your persistence, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $12750 and my previous offer of $13500. I can do $13250. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short of my budget. I'll make one more offer: $13000. Can you consider that?
I appreciate your final offer, Bob, but I'm not quite ready to sell at $13000. I can do $14000, which is still a good compromise. What do you think?
